resources.string: This Creates a New Normal Button
This button simply sends whatever key you set as a keybind when clicked and will release when you release the button."
\"&\" Modifier: more keybinds to be pressed at the same time. EX: SPACE&7 Do not put spaces in-between keys.
This button holds the keybind clicked until it is clicked again."
\"&\" Modifier: more keybinds to be pressed at the same time. Do not put spaces in-between keys. EX: SPACE&7&SHIFT
This button cycles through a defined list of keybinds. Each click goes to the next keybind."
\":\" Modifier: Separates items within the cycling list. An infinite amount of keys can be list using this modifier. EX: 1:2:3:4
This button creates a joystick button that allows users to slide in 4 directions to press the corresponding keybind."
\":\" Modifier: Separates items within the joystick list. Only 4 keys can be set using this modifier, no more no less. EX: \"W:A:S:D\"
This button allows for horizontal scrolling through a keybind list. You can select which keybind you want to press by swiping left or right."
\":\" Modifier: Separates items within the cycling list. An infinite amount of keys can be list using this modifier. EX: 1:2:3:4:5
Neon is testing your network connection to determine if any required ports are blocked.\n\nThis may take a few seconds…

Your network does not appear to be blocking Neon. If you still have trouble connecting, check your PC\'s firewall settings.\n\nIf you are trying to stream over the Internet, install the Neon Internet Hosting Tool on your PC and run the included Internet Streaming Tester to check your PC\'s Internet connection.
The network test could not be performed because none of Neon\'s connection testing servers were reachable. Check your Internet connection or try again later.

Your device's current network connection seems to be blocking Neon. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.

The following network ports were blocked:
Your device\'s current network connection is blocking Neon. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.
Computer is currently in a game. You must close the game before pairing.
Please enter the following PIN on the target PC:
If your host PC is running Sunshine, navigate to the Sunshine web UI to enter the PIN.
Unable to wake PC because there is no stored MAC address
It may take a few seconds for your PC to wake up. If it doesn\'t, make sure it\'s configured properly for Wake-On-LAN.
The ComputerManager service is not running. Please wait a few seconds or restart the app.
GFE returned an HTTP 404 error. Make sure your PC is running a supported GPU. Using remote desktop software can also cause this error. Try rebooting your machine or reinstalling GFE.
Neon has crashed due to an incompatibility with this device\'s video decoder. Try adjusting the streaming settings if the crashes continue.
Your device\'s video decoder continues to crash at your selected streaming settings. Your streaming settings have been reset to default.
USB access is prohibited by your device administrator. Check your Knox or MDM settings.
Your current launcher does not allow for creating pinned shortcuts.
Video decoder failed to initialize. Your device may not support the selected resolution or frame rate.
Your network connection isn\'t performing well. Reduce your video bitrate setting or try a faster connection.
Something went wrong on your host PC when starting the stream.\n\nMake sure you don\'t have any DRM-protected content open on your host PC. You can also try restarting your host PC.
The host PC reported a fatal video encoding error.\n\nTry disabling HDR mode, changing the streaming resolution, or changing your host PC\'s display resolution.
Check your firewall and port forwarding rules for port(s):
Warning: Your active network connection is metered!
Searching for host PCs on your local network…\nUse the tutorial video below to setup your computer.
Are you sure you want to delete this PC?
Slow connection to PC\nReduce your bitrate
Incoming frame rate from network: %1$.2f FPS
Frames dropped by your network connection: %1$.2f%%
Are you sure you want to quit the running app? All unsaved data will be lost.
Unable to connect to the specified computer. Make sure the required ports are allowed through the firewall.
Unable to resolve PC address. Make sure you didn\'t make a typo in the address.
You must enter an IP address
That address doesn\'t look right. You must use your router\'s public IP address for streaming over the Internet.
Increase to improve image clarity. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices and slower networks.

Native resolution modes are not officially supported by GeForce Experience, so it will not set your host display resolution itself. You will need to set it manually while in game.

If you choose to create a custom resolution in NVIDIA Control Panel to match your device resolution, please ensure you have read and understood NVIDIA's warning regarding possible monitor damage, PC instability, and other potential problems.

We are not responsible for any problems resulting from creating a custom resolution on your PC.

Finally, your device or host PC may not support streaming at native resolution. If it doesn't work on your device, you're just out of luck unfortunately.
Increase for a smoother video stream. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices.
Increase for better image quality. Decrease to improve performance on slower connections.
Enable 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound for home-theater systems
Allows audio effects to function while streaming, but may increase audio latency
Use the touchscreen as a trackpad
If enabled, the touchscreen acts like a trackpad. If disabled, the touchscreen directly controls the mouse cursor.
Unchecking this option forces a gamepad to always be present
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble if your gamepad does not support it
Note: Some games can enforce a larger deadzone than what Neon is configured to use.
Enables a built-in USB driver for devices without native Xbox controller support
Use Neon\'s USB driver for all supported gamepads, even if native Xbox controller support is present
Long pressing the Start button will switch the gamepad into mouse mode
Enable back and forward mouse buttons
Enabling this option may break right clicking on some buggy devices
Switches the face buttons A/B and X/Y for gamepads and the on-screen controls
This can make mouse acceleration behave more naturally for remote desktop usage, but it is incompatible with many games.
Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble for the on-screen controls
Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3
Resets all on-screen controls to their default size and position
Are you sure you want to delete your saved on-screen controls layout?
Make the on-screen controls more/less transparent
Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking
Smaller box art in the app grid allows more apps to be visible on screen
Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming
Play audio from the computer and this device
Streaming at 90 or 120 FPS may reduce latency on high-end devices but can cause lag or instability on devices that can\'t support it
Lower display refresh rates can save power at the expense of some additional video latency
Disable on-screen connection warning messages while streaming
May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency
HEVC lowers video bandwidth requirements but requires a newer device
Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. HDR requires a GPU with HEVC Main 10 encoding support.
This will cause loss of detail in light and dark areas if your device doesn\'t properly display full range video content.
Display real-time stream performance information while streaming
Display a latency information message after the stream ends
View instructions on how to set up your gaming PC for streaming
View tips for diagnosing and fixing common streaming issues
Specify how to balance video latency and smoothness
Prefer smoothest video (may significantly increase latency)
Type in the keybind you wish to use.\nYou can set xbox controller keys, keyboard keys or mouse buttons.\nToggle <show name> to show the button name.
Are you sure you want to delete this layout?
Click once to hold, click again to release
Click to cycle through a list of keybinds
Scroll through a list of keybinds
Welcome to NEON!\nPlay any PC game on your phone with ease!
This is the layout list Page. This is where you can see all your game controllers.
Click on EDIT to begin editing your game controller.
There are 2 default layouts: one for keyboard controls and the other for xbox controls. Choose the one best for you.
To create a new custom layout click on the NEW button.
To delete a layout click on the DELETE button.
To customize a layout, click on the EDIT button.
After selecting the layout you want, click on the ROCKET to use it with your game.
This is the layout create page! This is where you edit layouts.
Clicking on this button will open the button drawer.
This is the button drawer. This is where you can create buttons for your game layouts.
There are many different types of buttons with different functions. Click a button to create one.
You can now move the button by dragging and you can scale it by using the pinch gesture.
To learn more about how the selected button works, click on the info button.
To change the keybind of the selected button click on the edit button.
To change the look of the selected button click on the texture button.
To delete a button click on the delete button in the left corner.
To reset the layout click on the reset button.
To learn more about this page watch this video tutorial.
If you want to start playing with your current layout, click on the launch button.
To go back to the layout list click on the exit button.
This is the computer list page! This is where you can see all the computers you are able to connect to.
If you see a computer click on it to start playing!
If you do not see any computer simply follow this tutorial to get started.
When you see a computer appear in the list click on it to connect.
If you see a computer with a yellow warning then the computer is having connectivity issues, try restarting the app or changing networks.
This is the game list page! This is where you can see all the games you can launch.
If you do not see any games, simply add your desired game in the applications tab of sunshine
For more information refer to the provided tutorial.
If you see a game, click on it to start playing.
This is the Launch Page! This is where you actually play your games.
The layout you selected within the layouts list page will appear above your game.
Clicking on the buttons will activate whatever keybinds they have been given.
Swiping on the screen will move the mouse cursor like a trackpad.
Tapping will left click the mouse.
Swiping the screen with 2 fingers will scroll the screen.
Tapping the screen with 3 fingers will show the keyboard.
If you have an xbox controller simply connect to it and NEON will automatically connect.
If the screen is blank you may have to manually open the desired application on your computer
Exiting the selected game will end the connection.
This layout is locked, try premium to unlock.
Restart the app to apply changes.
Too many buttons, feature requires premium
Cannot delete the default layouts, please choose another
Could not connect to the internet, please reconnect and restart the app.
Are you sure you want to reset this layout?
